title: riot. please stop patronizing your players
body: your punishment system doesnt "reform" players, it simply bullies them into not talking or talking less, deep down. theyre still the same sarcastic asshole they were before. even if they're considered "reformed" by riot.

replies.body: I don't care if you're secretly pissed.  So long as you don't tilt my other teammates, I'm happy.
that wasnt really my point, my point being, riot treating it's players like kids is whats destroying the game
Exactly.  Just grow up and stop cussing teammates out.  Someone who has truly grown up will try to rally their losing teammates rather than complain about them.

treating people like kids on a video games? man wow how to take that in..... lets think..... no shit there are kids on a video game. even for us who are older and not considered a kid still sometimes have a kid's mentality that makes us want to play a video game. how old are you? if your under 25 and as a  male (assuming of course) mentally youre not fully mature and some ( psychologist) would consider your mentality as an    adultolescence. so that being said how else are they suppose to deal with people who act impulsively, immaturely, or better known as a damn kid throwing a tempter tantrum? because that is what rage, flaming, afk, ect is. lets be real. RIOT dont care about reforming a player, they care where or not that player who has issues will shut up and behave for 35 mins so the 9 others playing  their game will have good time and continue playing. and you wanna know why? a happy fan base is a fan base who buy stuff ,  who watches events and guides ect. if you piss off all the majority who act right then your left with a bunch of immature kids "taking their ball and going home" and riot dont make $$$$$
Players reform by themselves after learning they will be banned if they continue to flame
my point being though they arent really "reformed"  just silenced

you really can't change others if they decide to not to change.

If that is the case, I prefer silence over reform.
fine. im just saying to stop calling it reform

Most people do reform upon chat restriction. The silenced ones are either the ones on 14-day ban tier and afraid of perma, or the permaed then creating a new account in fear of getting punished again. 

You are reading too much angry post from here and reedit (or any other forms of media).
i believe you're missing what i'm saying. im suggesting that players who are punished don't actually "reform" so much as "ok fine i just won't type"

Just your opinion bro.

That's why I say you read too much of the negative stuff here and reedit, or any other media source.

That's what you might be saying, but that doesn't make it true.
There are a lot of people who do understand that they were in the wrong. Hell, even of those that technically do not count as reformed, there are some who understand they have a problem and try to deal with it.

If anybody is being patronizing, it's you, by essentially belittling the effort some people put into changing.

it isnt RIOT's job to be their parent and raise the kids. it isnt riots responsibility to make them behave, riot has a responsibility to the major of people who dont act that way to enjoy the game that they have a right to play harassment free. so if riot chooses to chat ban them, ban them from games, or perma bans its best for the whole. now if riot could go to that lil fuker's home and beat his ass and stand him in a corner or take his games from him (oh that is what riot is doing) then maybe there is reforming. but just like the judicial system that sends people to prison. prison isnt going to reform you. it is meant to punish you for your wrong doing. now if you take it upon yourself while being punished,having a time out from society, that you reform your ways and keep it where when you get out that you wont repeat the same mistakes that got you there in the 1st place. that is one bettering themselves not a system enabling it. more then likely you will just end up as a more refined criminal. 

people need to take responsibility for their actions and when shit comes down hard on them they need to take that moment to reflect on how they got themselves in that situation and take it upon themselves to correct it.

The real story here is that they should just fire all their people that handle moderation at all.  They obviously aren't succeeding and thus RIOT would just save money not paying their salaries while keeping the community exactly the same as it is now.
